title: üêõ 405 is not responded when use middleware
body:
**Version**

Fiber: 1.12.4
Golang: 1.14

**Description**

Although there is another method on the same path, it still respond 404 if I use middleware. And if there is no middleware, 405 will be responded.

Refer from https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/issues/492.

**Code snippet**

Here is my code:

```go
func main() {
	app := fiber.New()

	app.Use(recover.New()) // <<<
	app.Use(logger.New()) // <<<

	app.Get("/v1", func(ctx *fiber.Ctx) {})
	app.Post("/v1", func(ctx *fiber.Ctx) {})

	_ = app.Listen("2333")
}
```

Some result with middleware:

```log
$ curl 127.0.0.1:2333/v1 -v
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 2333 (#0)
> GET /v1 HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:2333
> User-Agent: curl/7.55.1
> Accept: */*
>
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Tue, 07 Jul 2020 03:47:19 GMT
< Content-Length: 0
<
* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact

$ curl 127.0.0.1:2333/v1 -X PUT -v
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 2333 (#0)
> PUT /v1 HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:2333
> User-Agent: curl/7.55.1
> Accept: */*
>
< HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
< Date: Tue, 07 Jul 2020 03:47:43 GMT
< Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
< Content-Length: 14
<
Cannot PUT /v1* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31433480/86704990-fbec4d80-c047-11ea-93e8-8266d4cf41d8.png)

Some result without middleware:

```log
$ curl 127.0.0.1:2333/v1 -X POST -v
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 2333 (#0)
> POST /v1 HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:2333
> User-Agent: curl/7.55.1
> Accept: */*
>
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Tue, 07 Jul 2020 03:48:14 GMT
< Content-Length: 0
<
* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact

$ curl 127.0.0.1:2333/v1 -X PUT -v
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 2333 (#0)
> PUT /v1 HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:2333
> User-Agent: curl/7.55.1
> Accept: */*
>
< HTTP/1.1 405 Method Not Allowed
< Date: Tue, 07 Jul 2020 03:48:35 GMT
< Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
< Content-Length: 14
< Allow: GET, HEAD, POST
<
Cannot PUT /v1* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31433480/86704923-ed059b00-c047-11ea-8a2a-cfc060255d50.png)
